leadership.name: Prince Lethukukhanya
leadership.bio: Prince Lethukukhanya is a royal visionary and author dedicated to economic empowerment and legacy building. He leads the Wealth Mindset initiative, bridging traditional wealth preservation with modern digital assets.
leadership.longBio:
Prince Lethukukhanya is a royal visionary and author dedicated to economic empowerment and legacy building. As the founder of the Wealth Mindset initiative, he is committed to bridging the gap between traditional royal heritage and modern financial structures. His leadership focuses on creating sustainable pathways for community development and personal financial freedom.

He is the author of 'The Process,' a roadmap to sovereign wealth that emphasizes the importance of internal transformation before external success. Through his work, he continues to advocate for the preservation of African tradition while embracing the opportunities of the digital age, ensuring that legacy and innovation move forward hand in hand.

leadership.name: Prophet Oxbert Mintah
leadership.bio: Prophet Oxbert Mintah is a dynamic minister, prayer intercessor, and entrepreneur based in Johannesburg. Known for catalyzing revivals and empowering youth to fulfill their kingdom mandate, he is the convener of The Clarion Call and Co-Visioneer of the Ipray Conference.
leadership.longBio:
Prophet Oxbert Mintah, a Ghanaian national based in Johannesburg, South Africa, is a dynamic minister characterized by his diverse gifts. As a youthful preacher, teacher, prayer intercessor, writer, entrepreneur, and ordained Reverend minister, he operates under the influence of a distinctive prophetic unction. Noted for his impactful conferences and international speaking engagements, he has consistently demonstrated his ability to catalyze revivals and lead souls to Christ. His ministry prioritizes the revitalization of the body of Christ and the empowerment of the end-time youth to fulfill their kingdom mandate and accomplish notable spiritual feats. Additionally, he is a skilled psalmist, worshipper, and published author.

He is the convener of The Clarion Call, a global, interdenominational prayer platform that connects intercessors, prayer warriors, believers, and ministers of the Gospel across Africa, Europe, Asia, and the Americas. The Clarion Call's vision is to raise kingdom militants who will stand in the gap in prayer for churches, nations, families, and other entities. The aim is to cultivate men and women with a strong thirst for the things of God through His unadulterated word by grooming, nurturing, and tutoring them in the act of prayer. He is also the Co-Visioneer of Ipray Conference, an annual, interdenominational prayer summit in Polokwane, South Africa, aimed at raising intercessors for the body of Christ. Additionally, he serves at Power Zone Ministry International in Polokwane, South Africa.

He holds a diploma in Ministerial Leadership Ethics, Biblical Hermeneutics, Pentecostal and Charismatic Studies from W.W.A.C.C.E.I & THRONE-ROOM APOSTOLIC COLLEGE IN COLLABORATION WITH UNITED FELLOWSHIP ASSEMBLIES INT. His language proficiency in English is excellent, with skills in speaking, reading, and writing. He is also skilled in computer literacy, including Microsoft Office and Internet Explorer. His key skills and competencies include excellent analytical, oratory, and interpersonal skills, as well as problem-solving skills and the ability to work with a team.

book.title: The Process
book.tagline: The Royal Roadmap to Sovereign Wealth
book.preface:
Before anything meaningful takes shape, there is a season where nothing looks impressive.
No titles. No applause. No certainty that the effort will amount to anything visible. Only repetition, responsibility, and the quiet decision to continue.

This is the portion of the journey most people omit when they tell their story. Not because it lacked importance, but because it resists simple explanation. Becoming does not announce itself. It works beneath the surface. It reshapes posture, thought, and patience long before the world recognizes a change.

The process begins when survival stops feeling sufficient. There comes a moment when living reactively no longer satisfies the deeper pull within. Something asks to be ordered. Something demands discipline, direction, and intentionality. Not because life has collapsed, but because potential has become too loud to ignore.

I did not begin with clarity. I began with questions. There were years where progress felt slow and identity felt unfinished. Where responsibility came before recognition and lessons arrived without language.

I learned that growth rarely feels like elevation while it is happening. More often, it feels like dismantling. The process removes excess, sharpens what is essential, and tests what is genuine.

This book is for anyone standing between who they have been and who they sense they are becoming. For those who feel the weight of responsibility before the privilege of recognition. For those learning that leadership begins internally, long before it is acknowledged externally.

No one steps into greater roles by accident. People are shaped for them. Slowly. Deliberately. Often uncomfortably.

This is not a promise of ease. It is an invitation to endurance.

This is The Process.
